Responsibilities: * Create graphics for use on flyers and presentations of RLC events and initiatives such as food drives, fundraisers, etc. * Work closely and collaborate with Marketing and Public Relations to create designs tailored to specific events * Work with other non-profit organizations on potential event partnerships * Other related duties Qualifications: * Strong Photoshop, Illustrator or other design program skills * Strong Microsoft PPT and Word skills * Web or App design knowledge is a plus but not required * Self-starter; ability to initiate and work independently * Ability to interact professionally with potential partners in person, via phone, and email * Ability to multitask and prioritize All RLC interns will be working closely with the founders and have the opportunity to make true, large impact in their time with the organization. All interns will have entry, mid-stage, and final evaluations to further hone the intern’s technical and professional skills. This is a part-time internship with potential for academic credit. Interns are expected to work 20 hours per week. Apply: Interested applicants should apply for a Fall 2018 Internship by submitting a resume and a portfolio of previous designs you created to info@rescuingleftovercuisine.org. Candidates for initial phone screenings will be contacted.
10004.title: Graphic Design Intern

10004.description: Rescuing Leftover Cuisine, Inc. (\"RLC\") is a non-profit food rescue organization based in New York City that delivers leftover food from restaurants and caterers to local agencies such as homeless shelters and soup kitchens. We have thus far delivered over 1,000,000 pounds of food with the lowest cost per delivery in the industry. Our business model is centered around four stages: (1) proactively seek out businesses with leftover food for partnerships, (2) deliver excess, wholesome food directly to local agencies, (3) use our expertise in food rescue to consult each partner different ways to reduce food waste, (4) partners successfully graduate from the RLC food rescue program with reduced food cost and food waste. Position Summary: The Outreach Program is seeking two interns. The Interns will assist in recruiting volunteers and forming close relationships with charitable organizations in New York City. Responsibilities: * Contact volunteer groups and organizations to establish partnerships * Maintain community partnership details in database * Gather detailed information regarding charitable organizations * Assist in organization of special events with community members Qualifications: Strong communication skills. Passionate about RLC and food rescue. Self-motivated; ability to initiate and work independently. Ability to multitask and prioritize. Ability to work quickly to meet the demands of a fast-paced environment. RLC interns have the chance to work closely with the founders and have the opportunity to make true, meaningful impact in their time with the organization. All interns will have entry, mid-stage, and final evaluations to further hone the intern’s technical and professional skills. This is a part-time, unpaid internship. Interns are expected to work 20 hours per week. May lead to full-time position. Apply Interested applicants should apply for an Internship by submitting a resume to info@rescuingleftovercuisine.org. Candidates for initial phone screenings will be contacted.
10004.title: Community Outreach Intern

10004.description: Rescuing Leftover Cuisine, Inc. (\"RLC\") is a non-profit food rescue organization based in New York City that delivers leftover food from restaurants and caterers to local agencies such as homeless shelters and soup kitchens. We have thus far delivered over 1,000,000 pounds of food with the lowest cost per delivery in the industry. Our business model is centered around four stages: (1) proactively seek out businesses with leftover food for partnerships, (2) deliver excess, wholesome food directly to local agencies, (3) use our expertise in food rescue to consult each partner different ways to reduce food waste, (4) partners successfully graduate from the RLC food rescue program with reduced food cost and food waste. Position Summary: Rescuing Leftover Cuisine is seeking a fundraising intern to assist in reaching out to different companies for sponsorships, help with formulation of donation campaigns, provide assistance in organizing fundraising events, and help applying for grants. Responsibilities: * Contact corporate groups to establish partnerships and sponsorships * Cooperate with other interns and employees to organize a great fundraising. * Lead and direct volunteers on the day of the fundraiser so that the event can take place on time. * Communicate with and motivate participants so that fundraising goals are met. * Write grant proposals to submit before deadlines. Qualifications: Self-motivated; ability to initiate and work independently Ability to multitask and prioritize Ability to work under pressure to meet deadline Passionate about food rescue Great communication and writing skills RLC interns have the chance to work closely with the founders and have the opportunity to make true, meaningful impact in their time with the organization. This is a part-time, unpaid internship. Interns are expected to work 20 hours per week. May lead to full-time position. Apply: Interested applicants should apply by submitting a resume to info@rescuingleftovercuisine.org. Candidates for initial phone screenings will be contacted.
10004.title: Fundraising Intern

10004.description: Womankind works with survivors of gender-based violence to rise above trauma and build a path to healing. We bring critical resources and deep cultural competency to help Asian communities find refuge, recovery and renewal from domestic violence, human trafficking, and sexual violence. The Youth Ambassador program's mission is to raise awareness, educate, and provide resources to youth in the community about gender-based violence, while empowering youth and supporting leadership development by providing a platform for youth-led activism. Youth ages 14-21 who are passionate about fighting against gender-based violence are invited to join a group of likeminded peers and make a difference in the NYC Pan Asian community! Youth meet weekly from 4:30pm-6:30pm one day a week starting in the fall. Email volunteer@iamwk.org for more information and to apply.
10004.title: Youth Ambassadors

10004.description: Womankind works with survivors of gender-based violence to rise above trauma and build a path to healing. We bring critical resources and deep cultural competency to help Asian communities find refuge, recovery, and renewal. Purpose/Overview: The Later in Life program started in 2012 to address the needs and challenges of older adult (age 50 and above) survivors of gender-based violence. 20% of Womankind’s clients are above the age of 50; the LIL program works to ensure that their needs are represented both internally (through our services and staff) and externally (through our advocacy efforts). This position will support our outreach efforts to the Chinese population in Queens or Manhattan (depending on the volunteer’s preference), and will help with facilitating workshops and groups. There are two phases to this position. The first phase will require the volunteer to assist staff in reaching out to places that older Chinese adults frequent in an effort to establish a partnership. The second phase will initiate once the partnership is established. The volunteer will begin to conduct workshops and groups in the site. The larger goal of this position is twofold: first, to create awareness around abuse in later life and connect survivors with services; second, to foster an active aging lifestyle among older adults through the workshops and groups. Supervisor: Miyoung Kim, MS, MA, L-CAT, R-DMT, Expressive Therapies Ph.D. student/ Later in Life Advocate Location: This position will be based in either Queens or Manhattan, and will require traveling between the Womankind community office and a partnered organization (possibly senior center, adult day care center, etc.) Key Responsibilities: Visit locations in Queens/ Manhattan (around Womankind’s community office) that Chinese older adults frequent: senior centers, adult day care centers, etc. Build a partnership with at least one possible site for us to conduct workshops and groups Conduct workshops around abuse in later life at sites at least once a month Facilitate support groups at sites on a weekly basis (this can be art groups, dance groups, etc. - depends on the comfort level of the volunteer) Expected Time Commitment: May 2018 (or as soon as possible) through April 2019 Schedule: Two weekdays per week, 4 hours per day (minimum). In the beginning, the volunteer will use the two days to visit possible sites and go through trainings for this position. After establishing partnerships, the two days will revolve around facilitating groups/ workshops and supervision. Hours will be flexible during the two days depending on the partnerships established (most likely will be in the earlier part of the day). Qualifications: Must be proficient in Mandarin and/or Cantonese. Should have a strong interest in working with older adults. No prior experience with conducting workshops or facilitating groups required - trainings will be provided. An interest in wellness activities/therapy strongly preferred. Orientation and Training Requirements: Volunteer will receive ongoing supervision and training as needed throughout this position. In the first couple of months, the volunteer will receive these trainings before we execute the workshops and groups: Abuse in Later Life Training (which will cover the types of abuse that occur in later life, ageism, and active aging) How to conduct presentations training Facilitating groups training Any other Womankind trainings will be made available (and optional) for the volunteer Support/Continuing Education: Individual supervision will be provided on a weekly basis for at least an hour. Supervisor will guide the volunteer in reaching out to places and building professional relationships. Supervisor will also assist the volunteer in conducting workshops and facilitating wellness groups. Volunteer will also receive support from the Later in Life Program Manager as needed. Volunteer will participate in a monthly Later in Life team meeting. Benefits: Professional mentorship Supervision credits if volunteer is a LCAT candidate Gain experience with conducting workshops and public speaking Learn to create and facilitate wellness groups Opportunities for advancement within Womankind Opportunities for growth as volunteer will be equipped with tools to work with gender-based violence survivors Opportunities to teach specific skills if volunteer is passionate about certain creative activities (knitting, yoga, craft, dance, cooking, etc.) Selection process: Submit a resume and cover letter to the Later in Life Program Manager, Kayla Chan ( kchan@iamwk.org) with the email title \"Later in Life Volunteer\". Selected candidates will be contacted for an initial phone interview with the Later in Life Program Manager. Applications will be accepted until the position is filled.
10004.title: Later in Life Intern/Volunteer (Mandarin-Speaking)

10005.description: Global Glimpse is looking for highly motivated and passionate career professionals to join our Rising Leaders Council (RLC) in New York City! The RLC is a diverse network of cross-sector professionals who work to build awareness around Global Glimpse programs while also supporting program expansion, fundraising, and network development for the organization, both regionally and nationally. The New York RLC meets monthly on the first Tuesday of every month in the financial district. RLC members receive the opportunity to grow personally and professionally through hands-on nonprofit board experience and have access to a national network of members who share a passion for global education and youth development. RLC members commit to supporting Global Glimpse in the following ways: Expand the Global Glimpse network by supporting with program expansion, fundraising, and network development; Assist with fundraising initiatives, special projects, and events; and Commit to a minimum $1,000 give + get annually. Global Glimpse commits to providing RLC members: Opportunities for local emerging leaders to develop nonprofit board experience and learn the inner workings of a fast-growing and successful international education organization with a unique business model. Access to a national cross-sector network of individuals who share a passion for global education and youth development in the SF Bay Area, Chicago, and New York. Exclusive invitation to regional programmatic events to engage with students. We’re looking for leaders in the corporate sector and those with a strong network in New York City. Current members represent companies such as Google, Salesforce, United Airlines, Barclays, Airbnb, and much more! APPLY BY JULY 31, 2018 at: www.surveymonkey.com/r/GG2019RLC
10005.title: Join the Global Glimpse NYC Rising Leaders Council!

10001.description: If you have experience in NYC events and would like to get involved, please email maya@mayashope.org with your resume and why Maya's Hope is important to you! We are looking for an events person to coordinate our volunteer appreciation event on WEDNESDAY, AUGUST 8th. Event planner would need to do the following: 1) help with coordinating the volunteers and manage them at the event 2) help with design and marketing 3) help with creating a theme 4) set up the event, set up the \"raffle\" giveaway station, make sure the event runs smoothly 5) pack everything up and coordinate a volunteer to bring everything back to our office 6) handle donations and help troubleshoot with technological issues (paypal swipes) 7) handle pressure well (if you get frazzled, this isn't the role for you!) 8) be accountable. This means, you believe in integrity, show up on time, do what you say you will do. :) PR Person: 1) Post event on any major blog/NYC events calendar 2) find groups to promote the event 3) finding young professional groups 4) promote Maya's Hope 5) work closely with Maya Rowencak to come up with strategies of promotion of event If you have experience in NYC events and would like to get involved, please email maya@mayashope.org with your resume and why Maya's Hope is important to you! Thank you for responding to our ad on Volunteermatch! Please learn more about Maya's Hope at www.facebook.com/mayashope and our website www.mayashope.org. If you would like to volunteer at the event, please email Maya to say YES you'd like to be part of it! We look forward to hearing from you!
10001.title: Event Planner needed August 8th Event

10001.description: PRO BONO NET SUMMER LEGAL INTERN: New York City Pro Bono Center & DisasterLegalAid.org About Pro Bono Net Pro Bono Net is a national non-profit organization dedicated to increasing access to justice through innovative technology solutions and collaborative partnerships that transform the way legal help reaches those in need. Our comprehensive programs enable the public interest legal community to make a stronger impact, increase volunteer lawyer participation, and provide resources and self-help tools that allow the public to understand their rights and resolve legal issues that threaten family security, livelihood and stability. To learn more about our programs, visit: http://www.probono.net/about/item.Mission. Description Pro Bono Net is looking for a legal intern to provide support for two key projects and will work closely with the staff attorneys that coordinate them: New York City Pro Bono Center: An online hub for lawyers, law students and legal professionals engaged in pro bono work in NYC. Specific tasks include: curating news and calendar events, working with our partners to publish our monthly newsletter/e-calendar, responding to membership requests and inquiries, and providing strategic and administrative support to the Pro Bono & Strategic Initiatives Coordinator as needed for the NYC Pro Bono Center and the broader probono.net/ny practice areas. org: A national website that provides legal rights information for people affected by disasters and resources for advocates serving those affected. Specific tasks include curating news and calendar events, assisting with the development of a social media presence (Facebook and Twitter), and providing general strategic and administrative support to our Disaster Response Legal Fellow as needed. The time commitment for this position is flexible, however the ideal candidate will work a minimum of 3 days per week for approximately 6-8 weeks. The intern should have a personal laptop available for use. This internship is unpaid. Requirements & Qualifications First and foremost, a strong interest in the access to justice movement and the use of technology therein, and a desire to learn about the work of the nonprofit legal-tech community in NYC and nationally. Detail oriented and highly organized, with ability to multitask, establish priorities and track projects. Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Pro-active attitude and ability to work independently with minimal supervision. Able to quickly learn new skills using software and above average proficiency with computers and technology. College students and law students are encouraged to apply. Application Instructions The internship is part-time, for no less than 3 days a week for at least 6 weeks, ideally to begin no later than July 9 th, 2018. The internship will be based out of Pro Bono Net’s office in Midtown Manhattan, but occasional remote work is a possibility. Email a resume, one page cover letter, and a short writing sample to jpenkoff@probono.net with the subject line: NYC/DLA Intern. Please note the hours and days you will be available to work. No calls please. Only those offered interviews will be contacted.
10001.title: Pro Bono Net - Summer Legal Volunteer/Intern

10001.description: Institute for Immigrant Concerns, a not-for-profit providing ESOL classes for adult immigrants and refugees, started in 1997, is looking for ESL instructors. Must have Bachelor's or MA Degree and at least 2 years of English teaching experience (whether domestic or abroad). Our students are all motivated and studious adults. We put great emphasis on survival English, employment and cross-cultural awareness. Applicants should be available twice a week, on Tuesdays and Thursdays for our morning classes ( 9am-12pm). We are currently looking for ESOL teachers for the 4-week summer cycle ( July 17-August 9), and welcome anyone with the potential of teaching future cycles. Applicants must send us a copy of their resume and a brief cover letter.
10001.title: ESOL Teachers for Adult Immigrants

10001.description: Volunteer with GripTape GripTape challenges the notion that learning must be adult-engineered and guided, and instead creates opportunities for young people to follow their passions - as inventors, designers, and producers- through the GripTape Learning Challenge. We work with underserved high school-aged youth (15-19 years old) to provide resources and support that enable them to actively construct their paths for success. It is inspiring to bear witness as youth grow and ignite their learning passions, and young people tell us again and again how empowering and transformative it is to have full control over their decisions with consistent support from a person who takes genuine, deep interest in their efforts. We’re currently seeking part-time volunteers who are committed to youth development to support GripTape young people. Serving as a \"Champion,\" this opportunity allows you to: Offer motivation and encouragement to youth who are driving their own learning Actively listen and encourage GripTape youth without guiding or advising their decision-making We provide approximately 3 hours of training by video conference. Champions hold virtual calls - Google Hangouts, Skype, FaceTime - with Challengers every few weeks during their learning journeys with youth across the U.S. for 1-3 months per learning cycle. Hours are flexible, with regular check-ins set around the schedules of the youth and Champion. To volunteer with GripTape, please sign up here.
10001.title: GripTape Learning Challenge

10001.description: The Sales & Merchandising Intern will play a critical supporting role in the detailed management of the product lifecycle process, in tracking purchase orders and product samples, in preparing weekly sales reports, and other deliverables to ensure key product development and financial deadlines are met. Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: Reviewing and updating selling reports weekly, and helping prepare for bi-weekly best seller/business reviews Managing product placement and creating collections on GGP’s retail and wholesale website Creating and updating line sheets and e-catalogs Assisting in maintaining and merchandising the showroom and sample closet Staying abreast of industry trends and competitor activity through weekly market research, competitive shopping and analysis In addition to daily task, will learn about pricing, product development, retail math and more Qualifications: Available minimum 3 days per week, for 4 months, starting in May 2018 Interest in merchandising and sales Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment Strong organizational skills Proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint Must have a passionate curiosity and desire to learn about consumer and retail trends, including customer demographics, purchasing influencers, and emerging technology Specific Qualifications (but not necessary): Familiarity with Shopify SEO / SEM / Adwords Photoshop Location: 115 W 30th Street, Suite 400, New York Global Goods Partners is an equal opportunity employer _________________ Global Goods Partners is a non-profit, social enterprise based in NYC that is dedicated to alleviating poverty and promoting social justice by strengthening women-led development initiatives around the world. We partner with organizations, associations, and cooperatives worldwide that integrate their commitment to community development-specifically, improvements in education, health, women’s rights, and employment opportunities-with socially responsible income-generating enterprises. We create economic opportunity by offering design direction, generating demand, and bringing the unique, handmade, and quality fashion accessories that our more than 40 partners in 22 countries produce to the U.S. and international markets through our website, www.globalgoodspartners.org.
10001.title: Volunteer Sales & Merchandising Intern

10001.description: Thank you for your interest in Maya's Hope! Here's more about Maya's Hope: www.mayashope.org. Who should apply: Someone who has NYC event planning experience and has done events of 300 or more people. (Requirement: must have done NYC charity events and know the ins and outs of a silent auction!) When It’s flexible! We can work with your schedule, but you will need to be available all day and evening on Oct. 26th, the date of our Gala. And you will need to spend a day or part of a couple of days in our office soon for orientation. Venue: 583 Park Avenue About Maya’s Hope is a 501(c)3 organization that is dedicated to improving the lives of orphaned, special needs, and disenfranchised children on a global scale. We are looking for that special person who has experience recruiting, training and supervising volunteers for a New York City Gala. We have great volunteers; we just need you to organize their efforts to help make our annual Gala spectacular! This is our biggest fundraising event of the year and the cuties we help depend on its success. This is a part-time volunteer position that involves working both onsite and virtually. You should know how to use spreadsheets and google calendar in order to organize and schedule volunteer hours. If you have the Gala background, organizational and leadership skills, and enthusiasm we need for this important position, please send the following: 1) letter as to why you are perfect for this role 2) resume If you are a suitable candidate, we will contact you and please be prepared to provide three references who have worked with you at a charity gala. If you do not have experience with charity galas and silent auctions, you will not be considered. Thank you!
10001.title: Charity Gala Event Planner needed for October 27th (Pre-Planning involved)

10001.description: We are looking for amazing and exceptional individuals to join our host committee for the Maya's Hope Lotus Ball on Friday, October 26, 2018 at 583 Park Avenue! Maya's Hope improves the quality of life of disadvantaged, orphaned and extremely impoverished children around the world. This will be the 7th Annual Gala for Maya's Hope and you can help us reach our goal of $300,000! We are looking for individuals from a wide array of backgrounds: law, medicine, entrepreneurs, real estate, finance and those who want to make a difference! Here's what is required: -Purchase your ticket upon joining ($350.00) - Attend and actively participate in a majority of Committee Meetings In person participation is assumed although a conference call option will be available for those with special circumstances or last minute scheduling issues. - Commit to raising a minimum of $4,000 for the Gala through sponsorships, ticket sales, and auction items with the goal of securing at least one sponsor, one live auction item (Auction item needs include exotic vacation destinations, airfare, unique experiences such as celebrity chef-hosted house parties, rounds of golf with local celebrities, exclusive tickets to sporting or arts event, etc.) - Solicit sponsorships from at least five companies - Solicit in-kind donations such as graphic design and photography services, discounted printing, - Hand address and personalize invitations to at least 15 individuals from your personal network for the Gala. -Be Ambassadors of Maya's Hope -Have integrity and show respect to all volunteers, members of the committee, board and humankind :) If you meet these criteria, please send an email explaining why you would like to join and please attach a copy of your resume or LinkedIn page. Please email maya@mayashope.org. If selected, you will be part of an extraordinary event which directly impacts the lives of the children we serve. Here is a video from our 2017 gala: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zQyb8SHA02U&t=28s Here are photos from 2017 Gala: https://www.facebook.com/pg/MayasHope/photos/?tab=album&album_id=1748530808499062 We understand that not everyone has the time and resources to meet these expectations but still have a desire to help. To this end, there are other volunteer opportunities available for those individuals who are unable to commit to the full list of tasks outlined above.
10001.title: Host to Join Host Committee for Maya's Hope Lotus Ball 2018

10001.description: Do you love Instagram? Are you great at using social media effectively? Want to help us raise money and awareness for children in need? Then you might be just the person we are looking for! Maya’s Hope is searching for a Social Media Intern to coordinate and execute social media strategy and help with our accounts on Instagram, Facebook, and anywhere else we can get out the word about the Cutie Pies that we serve. . Maya’s Hope is a 501(c)3 organization that works to improve the quality of life for disadvantaged, orphaned and extremely impoverished children around the world, with a current focus on the Philippines and Ukraine. This role offers the intern a total immersion into a busy non-profit. You will be given an opportunity to take on as much responsibility as you want and learn as much as you want as you work to increase our social media presence, gain visibility for our organization, and help us raise the funds we need to continue our work. Key Duties -- Social Media Community Management Streamline company social media accounts (e.g. Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, etc.) to ensure uniform content and tone of voice Update accounts on YouTube, and any other appropriate social media platforms where we are not currently represented Increase our number of followers/donors by engaging with them on a daily basis Help create and design email broadcasts highlighting our activities and children Use polls and surveys to build our social media footprint and reputation Build Facebook 'likes’ by approaching potential supporters through other social media channels and email marketing campaigns Track key social media analytics on a monthly basis, including Google Analytics, Bitly statistics, LinkedIn company stats, etc. Key Skills Required Proven written and verbal communication skills An interest in marketing, communications, and social media Strong familiarity with key social media (e.g. Instagram and Facebook) and with Google Suite (e.g. Excel, Word) An ability to consistently demonstrate integrity, hard work, and effectiveness An ability to remain calm under pressure and a robust/resilient attitude towards challenges Excellent attention to detail and a high motivation to learn Skill at prioritizing work and completing tasks An ability to work independently and think creatively Must show up on time. J If this sounds like the internship for you, please send a cover letter and resume to maya@mayashope.org.
10001.title: Social Media and Instagram Intern

10001.description: Do you have a strong passion for the development of Africa? Do you have innovative ideas on how the youth can contribute to Africa’s development? Do you want to work directly with the African Development Bank, UNHabitat, the African Union, and the United Nations Economic Commission for Africa? Do you want to attend meetings at the UN Headquarters in New York? Do you love to network and meet people from all over the world? Then this position is for you! YALDA is a networking organization that is truly Africa branded : \"By Africans, For Africa!\". YALDA is a non-profit international organization established by Harvard University students in order to create a resourceful networking database for those with a strong interest in Africa. The network is centered around YALDA branches, primarily at African universities, and serves to increase the capacity of youth in Africa for developing positive leadership skills and to espouse an honest work ethic. YALDA US works on researching opportunities in Africa, fundraising activities, working with branches, maintaining relationships with UN and compliance with regulations as a 501 (c)(3). YALDA US is planning its annual fundraising event in New York and has vacancies for Event Management Interns to report directly to the YALDA US External Liaison Officer and YALDA US President. Please note this is an UNPAID internship. Brief: The YALDA US Event Management Intern is responsible for assisting the YALDA US Branch with planning and delivery of our fundraising event in New York. The purpose of event is to fund the YALDA Youth Hub being built in Botswana. If you love Africa and would love to see her develop, then this opportunity is for you! Responsibilities: Engage businesses, organizations and individuals for ticket sale purchases Engage local businesses and international organizations for event sponsorships Manage and assist in the coordination of activities during the event Create marketing materials and prepare team members for meetings by conducting research and developing strategies Coordinate activities with business partners and corporate sponsors Promote event in social media and other relevant platforms Knowledge, Skills and Experience: Previous experience in project management or event management Ability to work in a fast-paced environment Excellent attention to detail, organization skills and accuracy of work Ability to communicate in a professional manner and develop good rapport with both internal and external parties Work independently and tackle multiple proposals simultaneously Must have a strong interest in Africa Qualifications: This is a great opportunity for undergraduate, graduate students and working professionals Advanced PC skills; including Word, Excel, PowerPoint Other Candidates preferably located in New York, NY Must have constant and reliable access to internet www.yaldaus.org www.yaldafrica.org Please send your Resume and Cover Letter to yaldarecruit@gmail.com by 15 August 2018.Please quote \"YALDA US Event Management Intern\" in the subject line.
10001.title: YALDA US Event Management Intern
10001.org: Youth Alliance for Leadership and Development in Africa (YALDA)

Organize events designed to engage our target market. Develop and enact a strategy for digital communications with consumers and other key stakeholders to include artisan stories, product information, and resources. Personal Requirements: Excellent research, communication and writing skills Proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint Experience with social media, blogging and creating public relations campaigns Interest in and knowledge of fair trade and ethical business Able to commit to 2-3 days per week during the summer college break Specific Qualifications (a plus but not necessary): Experience in creating and implementing public relations campaigns, including familiarity with print and online media Proficiency with Photoshop, Shopify, SEO, Adwords Familiarity with e-mail marketing applications like vertical response Interest in fashion, design, or craft production Hours: 18-25 hours/week Email resume to sharrison@globalgoodspartners.org
10001.title: Marketing and Communications Intern

10001.description: Are you looking for employee engagement or team building activities for your company, department or group? Hudson Guild’s Corporate Volunteer Programs offer a wide array of opportunities. With offerings as varied as community service projects for at-risk teens, mental health counseling for low-income individuals, wellness services for older adults, arts programming, and early childhood education for children, the Guild provides services to people in need and other activities to ensure a vibrant, safe, and healthy community. Please contact Rebecca Dealy at rdealy@hudsonguild.org or 212-760-9800 for more information!

10001.description: Do you love Excel? Do you love data? Do you love creating tables and doing analysis! Well, we have projects for you! We are looking for a volunteer who will help go through excel sheets and organize it to make it more efficient for us to pull some crucial data. This volunteer will need to come into our office at least 3 hours a week. Required skills: -knowledge and usage of Google Drive, Dropbox, fast typing skills, Excel -self-motivated -attention to detail -can work alone -can do pivot tables, do analysis and provide other reports that can be helpful. If you have a resume, feel free to forward that over so we can see your skillset! Otherwise, please email maya@mayashope.org and explain why you want to volunteer for this fun position!

10002.description: Why volunteering for Upbeat? Upbeat is an organization committed to the development of communities in the South of Bronx, we believe that all children are innately musical and have a right to high quality, long-term music education. We actively seek to recruit those often excluded due to economic and social barriers. The volunteer will a vocational opportunity to explore and acquire invaluable skills that are transferable to non for profit administration, individual giving, external communication, database management, among other professional fields in the area of arts management and creative industries. We believe in supporting our peers and creating an environment that is fully supportive for the members of our team. Assisting them in possible connections for future opportunities, and mentoring them in other aspects of professional and creative endeavors. Responsibilities (Training and full support will be provided): Database management (Salesforce): Pulling reports (eg. A list of students based on a specific instrument) and updating records (emails, phone numbers, student status). Assist communication efforts with parents during class registration, concerts and special events. Assists with checklists that track the status of all communication efforts with parents and prospect parents on an ongoing basis. Support the organization and communication of prospect candidates for the upcoming fall session. Other clerical duties as needed.
10002.title: Internship and Volunteer Position

10002.description: We are looking for individuals who have the skills listed below to help us a fundraising event called Rock Against Dementia for our organization. Possess excellent social networking skills Ability to generate relevant information regarding the use of money Possess excellent research and development skills Charismatic and possess excellent customer service skills Possess effective oral and written communication skills Self-motivated, creative and possess excellent organizational skills Possess sound analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to accomplish tasks within limited time period Possess excellent time management skills Knowledge of all major operating systems like Microsoft Windows, Microsoft Office, and the Internet Ability to perform tasks in a collaborative and consultative manner We would love to have you on our team.
10002.title: Volunteers Needed for our 2019 Fundraising Concert in NYC

10002.description: In conjunction with Henry Street's 125th anniversary, we will be celebrating with a large community day event alongside our annual Dunk & Donate basketball tournament. This exciting new opportunity will increase brand visibility for our sponsoring teams, as well as offer a wider variety of sponsorship options. Form a company or individual five-person basketball team and enter the tournament at the level of your choice - the higher the level, the bigger your impact on our youth programs and recognition of your team. Our sponsors will have the opportunity to play one-on-one with students from our Boys & Girls Republic program. Team names and logos will be featured on the tournament banner displayed in the park; on the event t-shirt; printed program and website, and in our press releases and social media marketing. We are looking for volunteers to provide fun activities for the younger children at our event. Volunteers will teach a small group of children an interesting craft, dance, etc. for a set time period, and repeat the process as the volunteers send their group over to the next station. The kids will be stamped, and once all groups have completed each station, they will be given a prize bag. This ensures participation and attention.
10002.title: Dunk and Donate Kids Activities Volunteers Needed!

10002.description: -Assist teacher and provide classroom materials for students to explore and learn -Understand the basic principles in guiding behavior to promote a positive classroom envirionment -Lead and encourage participation of classroom activities -Design and maintian various bulletin boards to display students' artwork -Greet parents and effectively communicate program ammouncement to them -Additiional administrative tasks assigned
10002.title: Chinese Language Teacher Assistant

10002.description: Hello, Beacon after-school program has a really good opportunity for organizations to come in utilize our space for education classes or fitness class for free, YES FREE! If you are looking for a space to host any kind of class please feel free to email me. The times are 6:30-8:45 pm.
10002.title: Spacing for classes

10002.description: BECOME A COLLEGE ACCESS MENTOR at MANNY CANTOR CENTER! Empower a young person to make the best college choice and achieve life goals by becoming a College Access Mentor! WHAT IS OUR COLLEGE ACCESS PROGRAM? This program focuses and motivates students towards achieving their learning goals, whether that be a four year college or university or a vocational or technical school. With a combination of age appropriate and appealing college access activities, and consistent encouragement, youth have the tools and resources they need to succeed personally and academically. Mentors are a key component in encouraging students, and helping them to create a plan and pathway for education. WHAT IS YOUR COMMITMENT AS A MENTOR? Work one-on-one with a student as they navigate the college application process Help your mentee with creating their college list, writing their personal statement, and researching and reviewing scholarship options Serve as a role model, providing guidance and support Commit to attending each weekly mentor session from 6-8PM on Tuesdays, beginning September 25th and ending April 30th. There will also be a mandatory orientation on Monday, September 17th. There will also be formal opportunities in the spring to stay connected with your mentee through college readiness and career awareness activities. HOW TO GET STARTED! Fill out our volunteer application by visiting: http://cerv.is/m?0038gU3a60F Share you availability for a phone call screening in the additional details section of the application Prospective mentors will need to attend an in-person group interview to be considered To ensure the safety and security of all program participants you will be required to submit to a background check APPLY TO BE A MENTOR IF... You have experience and/or interest working with college bound students You are passionate about building a strong working relationship with youth. You want the opportunity to be a positive and consistent role model and make a difference in the life of a young person You are available to commit to every Tuesday from 6-8PM WE NEED YOUR HANDS. WE NEED YOUR HEARTS. GET INVOLVED BY VOLUNTEERING!
10002.title: Volunteer to be a College Access Mentor!

10002.description: Community Outreach Volunteer(s) serves as the face and voice of their organization, helping us to bridge the gap between our non-profit and the community. Their responsibilities include: - helping us develop programs for the organization and overseeing them from inception to fruition. They also monitor programs to fit regulations and handle communications with representatives of the community. We have programs in progress but need help managing these programs. - Develop community outreach activities and programs. - Represent the organization in a variety of public settings to increase awareness. - Evaluate needs of general public and community groups. - Strong computer skills, with proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, are preferred. - ideal candidates would exude a warm, engaging, and hospitable demeanor.
10002.title: Looking for Community Outreach Volunteers

10002.description: Our program needs tutors to instruct students in the areas of math, science, writing, reading and social studies, the five areas covered in the ( GED)tests. They may be required to assess students in order to create a learning program for each student. Instruct students on material needed in order to earn their GED. Teach basic skills encompassing math, science, English, and literature. Help students prepare and study for GED exam. Assess students' readiness to take exam.
10002.title: G.E.D. tutor/instructor

10002.description: We are a small growing environmental nonprofit with a budget of around $75,000 We have two summer camps with 1099 employees We work with NYS discretionary funds and submit receipts for reimbursements. Experienced with online QuickBooks
10002.title: Experienced online QuickBooks bookkeeper helping nonprofit enhance community gardens

07003.description: Life is limited when you can't read medical label warnings, correspondence from your childrens' teachers, instructions on a new appliance, complete a job application, read a street sign, directions, or apply for a driver's license. Yet many adults find themselves in exactly that position, particularly here in Essex County, where one in every four adults is considered functionally illiterate in English, according to U.S. Department of Education data. When you help an adult, you help her or his entire family. At Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex & Passaic Counties, we have a long list of U.S. citizens and immigrants, among them refugees and asylum seekers, waiting for help in learning to speak, understand, read, and write in English. But we need volunteers to teach them. Here's how you can help: Become a volunteer literacy tutor by attending our 18-hour tutor training course at Bloomfield Public Library 90 Broad St., Bloomfield, NJ Tuesdays and Thursdays 12:00-3:00 p.m., October 2, 4, 9, 11, 16 &18 2018. Volunteers work once per week for two hours or more and earn a certificate as tutors of Basic Literacy and English for Speakers of Other Languages from Literacy Volunteers of America (LVA), one of the largest non-profit adult literacy organizations in the country. And more than that, they help improve the lives of adults and their family members. For more information, please contact LVA at 973-566-6200, ext 225, via email emartin@lvaep.org, or register through our website www.lvaep.org.
07003.title: Times are hard, you can help!
07003.org: Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex and Passaic Counties

07003.description: Be a Literacy Volunteer Share the Gift of Reading, Writing, and Speaking English Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex & Passaic Counties (LVA), is a non-profit organization dedicated to helping adults improve their ability to speak, read, and write English. As an LVA volunteer, you can help people achieve a more rewarding life through weekly tutoring in reading, writing, and speaking English. We have a long list of students waiting for help. Our students are comprised both of English speakers who need help becoming proficient at reading and writing, and speakers of other languages who need help learning English. The first step to becoming an LVA tutor is to register for one of Tutor-Training Workshops. Please visit our website at www.lvaep.org or call 973-566-6200, ext 225, or text 973-441-3200 for more details. \"Literacy is a bridge from misery to hope.\" Kofi Annan
07003.title: Share Your Gift of Literacy
07003.org: Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex and Passaic Counties

07869.description: Volunteers at iCan Bike-Randolph,NJ have an opportunity to help a person with a disability become an independent rider on a two wheeled bike in one week. Physically fit volunteers, 15 and older, will act as spotters and will walk/jog alongside the rider. Each day there are five, 75 minute sessions. Volunteers are requested to sign up for one or more sessions, Monday through Friday so they can work with the same person all week. Volunteers assist the rider to learn to ride by keeping their balance, steer, and offer encouragement and praise for their efforts. Volunteers and riders develop a friendship and share in the rider's success at the end of the week. This achievement creates a gateway of opportunity for socialization as well as participating in a healthy activity which in turn contributes to a healthy lifestyle. This helps them gain assurance and self-reliance in many other aspects of their lives with an \"I CAN\" attitude. We have seen from our volunteering at another iCan Bike Camp that volunteers left each day with a smile, having gained as much satisfaction as the riders knowing they have contributed to another's happiness. For videos, go to: www.icanshine.org/ican-bike-randolph-nj
07869.title: iCan Bike-Randolph, NJ

07869.description: We want volunteers like you to help make the ride a success. Volunteers are needed to help with ride weekend on Saturday, September 15th from 7AM - 11AM at Randolph, NJ. To sign-up visit http://bit.ly/BikeMSCountryChallenge2018 or email Michelle Almeida at Michelle.Almeida@nmss.org. We can’t wait to hear from you! When: September 15th from 7AM to 11AM Where: Randolph, NJ. How: To register, Visit http://bit.ly/BikeMSCountryChallenge2018 or Email Michelle.Almeida@nmss.org Thank you for your support!
07869.title: Cheer at Bike MS: Country Challenge's Randolph, NJ Rest Stop!
07869.org: National Multiple Sclerosis Society - New Jersey Metro Chapter

07087.description: Use your skills to help the immigrant community and experience the joy of helping someone change their life. We are looking for committed volunteers to teach Spanish speaking students. Volunteers teach one, three-hour class a week for ten weeks. All classes are on Sundays. Previous teaching experience is not necessary, but commitment, ability and a desire to teach are key. Our teachers have included those with experience, those undergoing teacher training and those who have no experience at all. Some classes require Spanish speakers, but some do not. Comite En Union para Salvadorenos (CEUS) is a 501 (c)3 non-profit organization based in Union City, NJ that was founded by Central American refugees to help immigrants create a better life for themselves. The classes are now offered at Centro Comunitario CEUS, our community center 15 minutes from Manhattan. Our website is www.ceusnj.org. CEUS has organized ESL classes for 23 years.
07087.title: Teach English to immigrants - change your world and theirs!

10573.description: Open Door Family Medical Center is partnering with Feeding Westchester (formerly the Food Bank of Westchester), to bring a free \"market on wheels\" to the Port Chester Community. Each month fresh, nutritious food will be provided to those-in-need. The food is set up as a farmer’s market so that people can walk through and select their own food, including fresh protein, dairy, produce and grains! Volunteers will help set up and distribute food products along with breaking down cardboard boxes. Location: Open Door Family Medical Center 5 Grace Church St, Port Chester, NY (Mobile Pantry in Parking Lot on Purdy St) Requirements: Able to lift 30 lbs. Spanish Language Skills beneficial High School Students Welcome! On-line Application Completed When: One Saturday a month August 25th, Sept. 15th, October 13th, November 10th, December 15th This is an express interest listing - a follow-up email will allow you to sign-up for available time-lots. For additional information, please contact Jane Levy, Manager of Volunteer Programs: jlevy@odfmc.org.
10573.title: FREE Nutritious Food - Help Distribute at Mobile Pantry
10573.org: Open Door Family Medical Centers Inc

11249.description: Our goal is to improve diagnosis and treatment for the most common chronic illness in the US - autoimmune disease. We are planning a fund raising event in New York City and are looking for someone to help organize it. Times are in reality more flexible than posted. We need an individual with passion, intelligence and initiative. This is a volunteer opportunity but if the fundraiser is successful it could lead to paid employment with ARI.
11249.title: Manager for NYC Fundraising Event

08857.description: KiDz HuB Media Network and Neverland Natives Visuals are looking for dedicated volunteers to help plan our first ever KiDz HuB Regional Film Festival! We're looking for volunteers that are passionate about getting kids involved in the arts and are able to put in hard work in order to get a recently announced festival prepared by the end of the summer. We have two general interest meetings from 4-5 on June 14 and June 21st at the address provided in our Location section. After that, we will have meetings every Thursday night from 5-7 in order to prepare for our festival on August 10th. Volunteers work closely with the event staff to plan the festival itinerary and distribute promotional materials to local businesses. Hopefully, we'll see you there!
08857.title: KiDz HuB Regional Film Festival NEEDS Volunteers!

08857.description: Hi Volunteer, We are very excited to announce our launch of Healthy Kids Running Series (HKRS) in Old Bridge this Fall and Next Spring and would love to have your support. We will be seeking the help of volunteers to be responsible for stretching runners, leading warm-ups, helping with on-site registration, marshaling the course, etc. We are therefore providing opportunities to promote a healthy lifestyle for kids, tweens, and teens, to meet our neighbors and make friends while providing volunteer opportunities? KiDz HuB has applied to be the Community Coordinators for the Healthy Kids Running Series in Old Bridge and we would be honored to have you as part of our team, to help to make this successful. Healthy Kids Running Series is a great way to spend time in the community and meet other families in your town. All volunteers will receive an HKRS KiDz HuB tech shirt for your help! Please sign up to volunteer with us for the Healthy Kids Running Series (HKRS) in the Fall and Spring Thanks ORLANDO \"Uncle Lanze\" DILLON Founder/Director | KiDz HuB Media Network Inc. Tel :732 HuB z HuB or 732 482 9482 Ext. 1002 | email o.dillon@kidzhub.org KiDz HuB | 3171 US Highway 9 North | Suite 317, Old Bridge NJ 08857 Facebook- www.facebook.com/KiDzHuB Twitter- www.twitter.com/ KiDzHuB Instagram- www.instagram.com/ KiDzHuB YouTube- www.youtube.com/ KiDzHuB Website- www.KiDzHuB.com
08857.title: Healthy Kids Running Series - Old Bridge NJ #HKRS

11217.description: The Human Resource Assistant position at A Free Bird provides support to the HR Director for all HR administrative processes. The role will be responsible with assisting with recruitment, onboarding, and researching information pertaining to the Human Resources Department. The Volunteer/Intern will maintain records and information for the business. The assistant will schedule appointments, have the ability to work independently and within a team environment; ability to efficiently organize materials and information, ability to easily adjust to changing conditions, maintain effective working relationships with employees an individuals. Responsibilities: -Creating spreadsheets & documents within google drive and Microsoft office. -Assisting with Calendar appointments -Scheduling and participating in interviews -Recruitment & Onboarding of new team members -Organizing and updating documents relating to HR - Creating a pool of volunteers and interns - Updating and posting of jobs online - Evaluating resumes as per job descriptions -Communicating with volunteers/interns and outside representatives as required Competencies: -Working towards/completed a qualification in Human Resources -Ability to maintain confidentiality at all times -Understanding of Google Drive -Understanding of Microsoft Office Suite - PowerPoint, Excel & Word -Highly organized and professional
11217.title: HR Assistant

11217.description: READ 718 is looking for volunteer literacy tutors for our Fall cycle (September 24-December 6, 2018). Volunteers must attend an orientation and one training session. READ 718 is a non-profit literacy center that provides afterschool tutoring and literacy workshops to low-income students in grades 3-8. We are looking for dedicated, reliable, caring, positive people who are committed to working with a child twice a week for 10 weeks (September 24-December 6), excluding Public School vacation dates. Tutors will be provided with easy-to-follow lesson plans for each session, and will have access to reading specialists for questions and guidance. Children who are behind in reading after grade 3 and do not receive the targeted instruction that they need simply fall further and further behind. READ 718 aims to provide students with high quality, supplementary instruction to bridge the gap between students who are struggling and their grade level peers. If you are interested in being a volunteer tutor, please visit our site and complete application at: http://read718.org/volunteer-application/
11217.title: Volunteer Literacy Tutor Needed for Fall

11226.description: click here.Work with Adult Literacy Students at one of the five Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers. Help them reach their personal goals. Lead reading and writing activities for small groups of adult learners who read below the fifth grade level. Assist them in using technology. We provide a 20 hour Volunteer Tutor Training where you will learn the BPL’s Literacy Program’s philosophy, how to use the library’s resources for instruction, and how to create effective lesson plans. Professional staff will encourage your development in this richly rewarding field. Volunteers must have a high school diploma or equivalent and a love of reading and writing. Volunteers are asked for a one year commitment to tutoring either 2 - 2 hours sessions, or 1 - 3-hour session per week. To learn more about the Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers, please visit the BPL website at http://www.bklynlibrary.org. To register to attend a Volunteer Information Session, please click here.
11226.title: Literacy Volunteer Information Session
11226.org: The Learning Centers @ Brooklyn Public Library

11226.description: Providing Legal Permanent Residents (LPRs) a transparent pathway to Naturalization. Who: Volunteer (you) What: Through this opportunity, you will lead/assist with the instruction of LPRs in preparation to apply and become a Naturalized U.S. Citizen. We will attain this goal by utilizing Civics materials provided by USCIS and through your engagement of creating weekly lesson plans directing the topics of the week. Duties: Creation and teaching of weekly lesson plans 4/5 Assessments of Clients knowledge through this class 1/2 Mock Interview with Clients Participation in our Naturalization Workshop - providing clients and the community with free legal support in creating their N400 Application Reliable and Responsible When: Duration: 12 Weeks (Aug 18 - Nov 3) Time: 9am - 1:30pm (Saturday Commitment) Size: ~15 clients Where: Holy Innocents R.C. Church (Brooklyn, NY 11226) Why: Many legal green card holders are taken advantage of by outside organizations, paying outlandish fees and receive no results. Through our class we are providing Application for Naturalization help through a BIA Accredited lawyer and through our class, you will aid clients in understanding U.S. History and Civics. **Through our prior classes we have aided over 15 clients to become a Naturalized citizen with the help of completing their Application for Naturalization (N400), Civics and Citizenship Class, and Case Management. DLM (501c3): https://www.dlm.ngo/citizenship USCIS Resource: https://www.uscis.gov/citizenship Interested in this opportunity? Send your resume to \" contact@dlm.ngo\" Subject \"Volunteer - Pathway to Naturalization\" A member of our team will follow up with you.
11226.title: DLM: Teach Civics and Citizenship (to LPRs in Brooklyn)

06902.description: 130 volunteers are needed to support the 7th annual Domus NINER, an adult CrossFit athletic competition where awesome athletes compete for top prizes such as rubber chickens and kazoos. The money raised through sponsorships (about a quarter of a million dollars) is used to support our schools. Volunteer activities include: volunteer registration, way finding, water station, cheerleading, face-painting, handing out bananas, and other fun positions.
06902.title: Domus NINER

06902.description: Domus Open Gym Night launched this summer at our Lockwood Avenue, Stamford, location. Meant to offer a safe and fun place for teens to spend the hours between work or school and bedtime, in addition to basketball they'd like a safe place to share their creative talents. Beginning at 6:30p on Wednesday, September 26, Spoken Word Night will have its Grand Opening. and we're looking for food volunteers to to help make the evening festive. These are teenage boys and girls, so pigs-in-a-blanket, guac and chips, hummus and carrots, brownies, etc. are the height of haute cuisine! If you have the time to make and drop off a dish for 10 people, we'd appreciate it. And please consider staying for a while. Every poet needs an audience. To know more, write me.
06902.title: Spoken Word Night Food

06902.description: As a non-profit organization, the American Liver Foundation relies on the support of volunteers to keep moving forward in the fight against liver disease. The Liver Life Walk has a variety of volunteer options available. Volunteers are needed to help out in all areas of the Liver Life Walk including Registration, T-Shirt Tent, Water Stations, Route Monitors, Cheerleaders and more! Wear comfortable shoes- as you will be on your feet for a majority of this event.
06902.title: Liver Life Walk Stamford 2018

06903.description: Welcome Visitors to the Museum; answer questions about Exhibits; respond to Phone Inquiries. Docent training provided at the start of each new exhibit. Time Commitment: Minimum 3 hours per week, during Museum hours. This is an especially good volunteer opportunity for students both during summer vacation time as well as fulfilling their school community service requirements.This position can be filled by students giving one Saturday afternoon a month to the Society. Seniors looking to meet new people and continue learning about their community have found this to be an interesting way to accomplish those goals. We are flexible in that volunteers can come in weekly or biweekly depending on their schedules.
06903.title: Docent

06903.description: Assistant Treasurer with the following duties: Reviews weekly cash deposits Receive, organize and pay bills Input accounting activity into Quickbooks Closing accounting books on monthly, quarterly and annual basis Organizing and archiving financial records Hours are flexible: Thursday, Fridays & Saturdays between 10:00 and 12:00 If you fit the bill and would like to help us, please get in touch with me. Thanks for your interest! Tom Porter Volunteer Coordinator - Board Member Stamford History Center 1508 High Ridge Road Stamford, CT 06903 www.stamfordhistory.org volunteer@stamfordhistory.org (O) 203-329-1183 (C) 917-701-3572
06903.title: Assistant Treasurer / Bookeeper

06903.description: Media/News Writer Volunteer, If you enjoy writing, this is the volunteer job for you. We are looking for someone to create press releases about the Stamford History Center for distribution to various media outlets (onlinenews sites, radio, tv, magazines, etc.). You will interview people in the organization to gather information. Once your article is reviewed by our volunteer editors, it will be sent out. It is essential that our media volunteer stays up-to- date with our activities, so press releases go out in a timely fashion. The position can be expanded to include the creation of newsletters and flyers (working with our graphic designer). This is a job that can be done largely from your own laptop/desktop, and at your own convenience. REQUIREMENT: Please write a two or three paragraph \"Press Release\" on one of the following topics: 1] About our Tag Sale 2] The opening of the Hoyt-Barnum House or 3] A past Historical Center event You can get ideas by going to our web site: www.stamfordhistory.org Forward it to me and we will review and get back to you. Thanks again for your interest in joining the volunteer team! Tom Tom Porter Volunteer Coordinator Stamford History Center 1508 High Ridge Road Stamford, CT 06903 www.stamfordhistory.org 203-329-1183 Skills needed: organized, experienced writer; a self-starter who can use Word and navigate the internet.
06903.title: Media/News Writer Volunteer

06903.description: Historic Home Docent & Museum Greeter We are looking for volunteers who would like to introduce visitors to our 1699 historic house museum, The Hoyt-Barnum House. You would be involved with greeting visitors with a smile and giving a brief explanation of the Center's offerings: a research library, photo archive, our current exhibit, and our historic house museum. People who wish to tour Hoyt-Barnum House first view an introductory film before starting the audio tour. You would be responsible for selling tickets and recording transactions, giving guests their audio pods and collecting them after the tours, opening and closing up the house museum, and monitoring visitors while they are in the house. Minimal training is needed. Museum Docents should be friendly and personable. They should be physically able to manage stairs and brief walks on a regular basis. Docents should be at least 20 years old and able to work at least one four-hour day, 2 x /month. Docents are needed for Thursdays and Fridays. Shifts are from noon to 3:15 pm on Thursdays and Fridays. Two docents are needed on Saturday: one from 10:30 - 1:00 and one from1:00 to 3:30 pm. You are welcome to stay longer to meet our other volunteers and make use of our facility. Check out our Website for loads of fun information: http://stamfordhistory.org/ Skills needed: -Basic math/money skills Hope to hear from you soon! Tom Tom Porter Volunteer Coordinator & Board Member Stamford History Center 1508 High Ridge Road Stamford, CT 06903 www.stamfordhistory.org volunteer@stamfordhistory.org (O) 203-329-1183 (C) 917-701-3572
06903.title: Stamford Historic Home - Tour Guide (No experience needed)

06901.description: New Volunteer orientation session will provide an overview of the Domestic Violence Crisis Center services, volunteer opportunities available, information on how to become a certified volunteer allowing one to work with victims of DV and completion of necessary paperwork to join the DVCC volunteer team.
06901.title: New volunteer orientation

06901.description: Stamford Academy serves about 135 high school students who have been unsuccessful in other schools. The number of students with Individual Education Plans (IEPs) is about twice the rate of Stamford Public Schools, yet Stamford is able to provide only one SPED teacher. You know how important one-on-one instruction is. Do you have a couple of hours to spare once a week during the school year to help tutor a student? Training provided. To meet our kids is to love them. They are wary and giving; have big dreams and struggle to stay on task; are talented and funny; and may have not had dinner the night before. If you'd like to know more, please contact me.
06901.title: Do you know what an IEP is? If so, read on...

07670.description: Dear Residents of Tenafly Public Schools Do you want to make a difference in a young person's life; while you learn about another culture, create and build friendships and make ever-lasting memories? Do you have a caring heart and extra space in your home? AnB Education is looking for you! Make a difference today and host an international student! All our students need is: A Private bedroom with a desk, bed and dresser 2 meals a day on school days and 3 meals a day on non school days Transportation to and from school if there is no school buses provided Please contact AnB Headquarters office at: 267.263.2481 or email to contact@anbeducation.com Company website: www.anbeducation.com
07670.title: Volunteer Host Families for International students

10466.description: We are currently looking for writing/literary arts teachers for our literary programs. Words vs. Pictures: This is our visual and literary arts program and you may spend some time throughout the year working with an artist/teaching artist. You will have the opportunity to create your curriculum to teach our students different writing disciplines and engage them in projects related to self-expression/exploration, current events, and other subjects of interest. You will work with the students to create works suitable for a show/exhibit at the end of the year. Bookworms: This is our book club for young readers. The club meets once per month during the school year. Read thrilling books and do fun activities with elementary school aged children to build their love of reading. Beyond Words: This book club is for teens. The club meets once per month during the school year. Engage middle and high school students in reading books with themes relevant to today's events. We are looking for writers/teachers that can teach various literary arts disciplines - poetry, short essay, biography, etc. Please contact us whether you are interested in teaching for the whole school year, a semester, or a particular subject/discipline for a limited time. We are open to the right teacher or combination of teachers. At Artsmith, we are dedicated to providing arts education to young people in the Bronx who have little or no opportunity to experience the arts. We know that the arts provide our students with a great and safe place to learn creativity, experiment and take risks, develop discipline, and build confidence. Arts education should not be a question of access. You must believe in this mission to volunteer with us! Email resume to tricia.smith@artsmith.org to be considered.
10466.title: Writing/Literary Arts Teacher

10467.description: I'RAISE Offers an exciting and rewarding opportunity to individuals seeking to become a role model and make a positive impact on younger youth. This exciting opportunity includes one on one mentoring, group mentoring and/or mentoring. Mentors work with mentees on developing goals for their life that will help them make social, emotional and educational gains! Ideal candidates include college students. students who need internship experience/volunteer experience, retired professionals or individuals who simply want to make a difference! If you are seeking an opportunity to invest in a youth and make a positive difference.
10467.title: Big Brother/Big Sister Mentor

10463.description: VOLUNTEER POSITION DESCRIPTION The Secretary serves on the Board of Directors. The Secretary is also a member of the Executive Committee. KEY ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Attends monthly Board and/or Executive Committee virtual 60-75-minute meetings. Prepares minutes of key decisions using meeting recordings; distributes minutes in a timely fashion, within 7-14 days. Assists with Board meeting reminders and scheduling of GoToMeetings as needed. Sets up Board meeting schedule six months in advance. Assists with internal calendar postings, Outlook email as needed. Updates and distributes internal contacts list, Board Attendance tracking, and Organizational Chart. Participates in by-laws review and handles by-laws requests in coordination with the governance team. Contributes to Strategic Planning goals and action plans. Provides administrative support as needed. QUALIFICATIONS Proficiency in Word and Excel. Experience in Office 365 / Outlook a plus. Excellent writing and grammar skills. Strong project and time management skills with exceptional attention to detail. Volunteer Details Term: Two (2) Years Time Commitment: Minimum of 5-10 mostly virtual hours per month; which may include evenings. Please submit the following documents for consideration: Resume or CV. Bio of 100-300 words using III Bio Guidelines. Candidates may submit materials electronically via Word or PDF to volunteer@imageimpact.org. ABOUT IMAGE IMPACT INTERNATIONAL Image Impact International, Inc. (III) is a global Non-profit 501(c)(3) organization. Our mission is to mentor first-generation students to remain in college. FOR MORE INFORMATION Contact VP-Human Resources Marisol Rosero-Allen at volunteer@imageimpact.org.
10463.title: Board Secretary - New York Metro Area

10463.description: Position Statement: Evening classes, 6:00pm-9:30pm Monday - Thursday The ESOL (English Students of Other Languages) Program Assistant will be responsible for one-on-one support to students during classroom English lesson plans, administrative support to the instructor/s, and technical aspects of assisting students with progressing computer-based language programs. Duties and Responsibilities: Provide participants with one-on-one assistance Assist with technical and administrative tasks Provide administrative back-up and support to ESOL Instructor Engage and retain students by developing supportive relationships Other duties as assigned by Instructor Qualifications: HS Diploma; Some college preferred Comfort with computer applications and data entry Available evening hours Organized, efficient, and task oriented English/Spanish Bi-lingual helpful
10463.title: ESOL Program Volunteer

We are requesting volunteers to assist with the set-up and breakdown of this event. Volunteers will also engage with the community/participants in various ways: sign them up to receive alerts/notifications from us help with the various raffles taking place this day take pictures of the health fair help set up proclamation ceremony w/ the Mayor and possible other selected officials hand out flyers/information
08861.title: National Health Center Week 2018

10003.description: We are currently looking for Volunteer Office Assistants to work in the afternoon and/or the evening. Volunteer Office Assistants serve 4-6 hours per week for a prestigious downtown NYC community theater that produces 25-30 new plays and 3 free community events each year. Volunteer Office Assistants will answer phones, take reservations, file papers and occasionally assist Executive Director Crystal Field by writing letters or researching on the internet. Opportunities available specifically on weekdays in the Morning/Afternoons from 10am to 4pm, or in the evenings from 4pm to 10pm, or on weekends from 12pm to 8pm. Volunteers will receive FREE tickets to all TNC productions.
10003.title: Administrative Assistance

11793.description: Volunteers are needed to help with this wonderful event to find a cure for brain tumors! The Long Island Brain Tumor Walk will be held at Jones Beach, Field 5 on Saturday, September 15, 2018. We have volunteer opportunities to assist with set up on Friday, September 14th during the day and a large number of opportunities available on walk day ranging from registration and incentive distribution to cheerleading for our walkers, to solicitation of donated goods to help make the event go smoothly for all. We are looking for coffee, water, snack and fresh fruit donations If you're unavailable that day but want to help distribute marketing materials or help with sponsorship, please reach out today! To see a full list of volunteer options visit: http://events.braintumor.org/events/long-island-brain-tumor-walk/volunteer-roles/. Please note that registration/banking volunteers are required to take a training over the phone via a zoom meeting, prior to the walk. We are seeking new members to join our walk planning committee for those who want to get involved year-round to help plan and execute the walk. All funds raised through our events allow the National Brain Tumor Society to advance research and public policy to improve the availability of new and better treatments, and fuel the discovery of a cure for brain tumors. Volunteers are the bedrock our existence and this special event would not be possible without you. Thank you for your time and generosity.
11793.title: Long Island Brain Tumor Walk

11797.description: Are you passionate in the fight to save lives and help create a world without cancer? Do you want to be a part of the official kickoff to breast cancer awareness season in Long Island? Event: The Corporate Breakfast is a high-energy, inspirational event where Team Leaders come to celebrate breast cancer survivors, learn about our research achievements, and discover the local programs and services we offer. Last year, the Making Strides Against Breast Cancer Corporate Kickoff Breakfast welcomed 1,000 guests, including 200 survivors. Breakfast attendees are team leaders from a variety of different industries, including Fortune 500 companies, large corporations, small local businesses, health systems, as well as members of the community. Description: The Making Strides of Long Island is seeking 10 volunteers to support our staff during the kickoff. Duties include but not limited to: *Final decorating details *Check-in of guests *Merchandise sales *Distribution of Team Leader gift *Collection of registration forms *Assistance with online registration (training provided) *Packing up and loading event materials *Photography of event Expectations: *Attire: Business Appropriate (not casual or business casual) *Arrive at venue at 6:30 AM for final instructions *Plan to stay until all materials packed and loaded into transport cars *Typically a modest spread of breakfast items are provided for staff & volunteers on a rotating basis, however please plan accordingly and come with energy to complete the morning For more information about this volunteer opportunity, please email Christine.haskell@cancer.org Please email your name ( First & Last), address, along with your phone number and email address. ------------------------------------------------------------------ The American Cancer Society's Making Strides Against Breast Cancer walks raise awareness and funds to save lives from breast cancer. The Making Strides of Long Island bring together more than 80.000 local participants and have raised more than $2,5 Million annually.
11797.title: Corporate Kickoff Volunteer

10019.description: Family and friends Day for the Harborview Seniors Citizens Set-up 10:30 am Volunteers are ask to help set up tables, pass out information and have fun with the seniors BBQ sets at 12:noon, At 4:00 pm break down tables and tent
10019.title: Family and Friends

10019.description: Estamos buscando un voluntario para acompañar a un encantador señor de 90+ años. Él vive en la parte sureste de la ciudad de New York. A él le encanta jugar domin ó , mirar noticias y novelas. Él te necesita solo una hora a la semana. GRACIAS. We match isolated and lonely seniors with volunteers in the community who make weekly visits in the senior’s home. The Friendly Visiting program is an opportunity to form rewarding relationships and ongoing companionship for both seniors and volunteers. Seniors and their visitor can converse and enjoy the company, take part in activities like going to cafes and museums, share stories, learn new skills, and a variety of other things based on the desires of the companions. You will be matched with a senior who has a similar personality and interests and you can decide together how to spend your time. Visits can easily fit into your schedule because matches are made based on your availability. We ask for a minimum commitment of 6 months or 1 year. Your time as a friendly visitor is invaluable, and you gain a new friend!
10019.title: Necisitamos Voluntario Para Acompañar Encantador Caballero De 90 Años - Adora Jugar Dominó ¡Gracias!

08902.description: Dear Residents of South Brunswick Public Schools Do you want to make a difference in a young person's life; while you learn about another culture, create and build friendships and make ever-lasting memories? Do you have a caring heart and extra space in your home? AnB Education is looking for you! Make a difference today and host an international student! All our students need is: A Private bedroom with a desk, bed and dresser 2 meals a day on school days and 3 meals a day on non school days Transportation to and from school if there is no school buses provided Please contact AnB Headquarters office at: 267.263.2481 or email to contact@anbeducation.com Company website: www.anbeducation.com
08902.title: Volunteer Host Families for International students
